decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm, to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and strong removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Voice of Victory help to control the board and maintain pressure. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and utility lands like Arena of Glory, while cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by removal spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Solitude. The deck aims to leverage the synergies between cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Goblin Bombardment provide disruption and alternate win conditions, adding versatility to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting opponents with taxing effects. It aims to apply pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponent's spells. Consign to Memory and Solitude provide removal options, while Prismatic Ending offers versatile removal. The deck also includes some land disruption with cards like Flooded Strand and Scalding Tarn. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents while disrupting their game plan with taxing effects and controlling spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. The key strategy revolves around maintaining board control with cards like Supreme Verdict and Solitude, while using Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also leverages the power of Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's card advantage. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for repeated use of powerful instant spells like Orim's Chant. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through strategic decision-making and superior card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Quantum Riddler. Consign to Memory and Solitude provide removal options to keep the board clear, and Ephemerate can be used to protect key creatures or reuse powerful enters-the-battlefield effects. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on exploiting artifacts to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, you can generate mana and create explosive turns to put your opponent on the back foot. Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke help control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures and utility artifacts, you can apply constant pressure and close out the game before your opponent has a chance to recover.

This deck aims to cast multiple spells per turn, utilizing mana ramp and card draw to generate a large storm count. By using cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Reckless Impulse, it can dig for combo pieces and set up lethal Grapeshot finishes. Wrenn's Resolve ensures that key spells can't be countered, while Past in Flames allows for recursion of important spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes Wish to tutor for specific cards and Valakut Awakening for additional card draw and hand manipulation. The main goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana quickly to cast powerful spells and combo off with cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot. It utilizes cards like Manamorphose and Ruby Medallion to accelerate its game plan, while also including Past in Flames to recur important spells. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to help find key pieces of the combo, such as Wish and Desperate Ritual. With the right setup, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and burn damage.

This Modern Control deck focuses on using a combination of card advantage, removal, and counterspells to control the game while also having access to powerful threats like Omnath, Locus of Creation. Quantum Riddler provides additional card filtering and Boseiju, Who Endures can help your spells resolve against control decks. The deck also includes recursion with Eternal Witness and interaction with Teferi, Time Raveler. Stock Up allows you to dig deeper into your deck while Orim's Chant provides disruption. With a mix of control elements and strong threats, this deck aims to outlast and outvalue opponents.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by powerful support cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. With a mix of efficient creatures, evasion, and removal options, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to quickly generate large amounts of mana. This enables the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths, as well as planeswalkers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck focuses on controlling the game with cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with Karn, the Great Creator. Overall, the deck aims to control the battlefield and overpower the opponent with its high-impact threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and speed up the process of casting Primeval Titan. By combining ramp spells like Scapeshift and Simic Growth Chamber with land tutors like Tolaria West and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly assemble the resources needed to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. The inclusion of cards like Aftermath Analyst and Malevolent Rumble provides additional utility and disruption, while the unique land base allows for flexible and explosive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana with Birthing Ritual in order to play powerful spells and creatures ahead of schedule. By ramping up their mana production, the player can overwhelm their opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Coiling Oracle and Ice-Fang Coatl, disruptive spells like Flare of Denial and Subtlety, and game-ending threats like Otawara, Soaring City. The deck also includes a number of versatile cards like Shardless Agent and Brazen Borrower to adapt to different situations and maintain pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory to control the board, while creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury keep the pressure on. The deck also features cards like Solitude and Ephemerate for removal and protection. By combining disruption with aggression, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents, creating a challenging and unpredictable play experience.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, while also drawing through the deck with Reckless Impulse and Wrenn's Resolve. The goal is to cast Past in Flames to recast key spells from the graveyard and finish the game with a storm of spells like Grapeshot. Ral, Monsoon Mage adds additional ways to generate mana and deal damage, while cards like Valakut Awakening provide card draw and flexibility. The deck also includes Wish to tutor for specific cards when needed.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board and protect its creatures. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support by boosting creature stats and locking down opponent's resources. The mana base is built to support a variety of colors to ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game.
